title: Precalculus /w Limits
subtitle: Groups, Rings, and Fields
description: A comprehensive introduction to abstract algebra, covering group theory, ring theory, and field theory. This course develops the fundamental concepts and theorems that form the foundation of modern algebra.
author: Kris Yotam

title: Single Variable Calculus
subtitle: Curves, Surfaces, and Manifolds
description: An exploration of differential geometry, from curves and surfaces to manifolds. Includes detailed discussions of curvature, geodesics, and the fundamental forms of surfaces.
author: Kris Yotam

title: Integral Calculus
subtitle: Theory of Functions of a Complex Variable
description: A rigorous treatment of complex analysis, covering analytic functions, complex integration, Cauchy's theorem, and applications to various areas of mathematics.
author: Kris Yotam

title: Multivariate Calculus
subtitle: Point-Set and Algebraic Topology
description: An introduction to topological spaces, continuity, connectedness, compactness, and fundamental groups. Bridges the gap between abstract algebra and analysis.
author: Kris Yotam

title: Mathematical Logic
subtitle: Foundations of Modern Analysis
description: A detailed study of measure theory, including Lebesgue measure, integration theory, and their applications to probability theory and functional analysis.
author: Kris Yotam

title: Mathematical Intuition
subtitle: The Language of Mathematics
description: An introduction to category theory, covering functors, natural transformations, limits, and adjunctions. Emphasizes the unifying role of categorical concepts in mathematics.
author: Kris Yotam
